Detailed Description

This class forms an interface to VoIP services implemented in the DLL voip.dll.

The BigWorld client implements a python wrapper to this interface that can be accessed in script though BigWorld.VOIP

Member Function Documentation

void VOIPClient::command ( const VOIPDataDict *  data  ) 

This is a generic function for handling implementation specific commands not exposed in the general VoIP interface.

Parameters:
data Optional: Additional information in the form of string value pairs

void VOIPClient::createChannel ( const char *  channel,
const char *  password = "",
const VOIPDataDict *  data = NULL 
)

Creates a new channel with the given name.

The creating user automatically joins the newly created channel. The channel will be destroyed when all users leave the channel. Default password is "".

Parameters:
channel The string that will uniquely identify the new channel
password Optional: The password that will be needed to access the channel
data Optional: Additional information in the form of string value pairs

VOIPClient * VOIPClient::createVOIPClient (  )  [static]

Creates a new instance of the VOIPClient The returned VOIPClient should only be deleted using the destroyVOIPClient() method.

Returns:
The new VOIPClient. NULL on error.

void VOIPClient::destroyVOIPClient ( VOIPClient *  client  )  [static]

Deletes a VOIPClient previously created using createVOIPClient().

Parameters:
client The VOIPClient to be deleted.

void VOIPClient::setChannelVolume ( const char *  channelName,
float  attenuationDB,
const VOIPDataDict *  data = NULL 
)

Sets the volume at which voice communications on the given channel play.

This attenuation is in addition to that applied by the master volume.

Parameters:
channelName The string identifying the channel
attenuationDB The new speaker volume attenuation in decibels(dB)
data Optional: Additional information in the form of string value pairs

void VOIPClient::setHandler ( VOIPResponse *  response  ) 

Sets the response callback handler.

The VOIPClient must not destroy this object.

Parameters:
response An object implementing the VOIPResponce interface. Passing NULL will clear the current handler.

void VOIPClient::setMasterVolume ( float  attenuationDB,
const VOIPDataDict *  data = NULL 
)

Sets the overall volume at which voice communications will be played.

data Optional: Additional information in the form of string value pairs

const VOIPDataDict *  data = NULL 
)

Sets the attenuation applied to the microphone input.

Parameters:

data Optional: Additional information in the form of string value pairs

void VOIPClient::tick ( float  x,
float  y,
float  z,
float  yaw,
float  pitch,
float  roll,
int  spaceID 
)

A tick function called each frame to allow positional audio filtering and unthreaded implementations.

Note: The given location is in world space

Parameters:
x The location of the player in on the X axis. +X is right
y The location of the player in on the Y axis. +Y is up
z The location of the player in on the Z axis. +Z is forward
yaw The current yaw of the player. 0.0f yaw is forward, +/- PI is backard
pitch The current pitch of the player. 0.0f pitch is level, +ve pitch is up (clockwise in Z-Y plane)
roll 
spaceID An integer uniquely identifying the space in which the player currently resides
